transcripts.text: Hey guys, my name is Garrett.
And we're here visiting Snowflex on top of Liberty Mountain.  Snowflex offers free tubing, skiing, and snowboarding for all students at no cost year-round.

And for those who don't know how to ski or snowboard, the Barrick Falwell Lodge offers free lessons for students as well.  And when you're done hitting the slopes, you can enjoy concessions or just the beautiful sunset scene from the top of the mountain.
And Liberty Mountain is covered with about 50 miles of trails, with many of them leading up to the Liberty Monogram, which looks over campus.

The Hideaway Outdoor Recreation Center is a great place for students to take a break from their studies.  Located less than five miles from Liberty's campus, the Hideaway Center includes an expansive trail system for students to run, hike, and bike.  Or, students can enjoy relaxing at the sandy beaches and swimming, fishing, kayaking, and more at the lakefront.

And right next door to the Hideaway lies the Liberty Mountain Gun Club.  This place has a state-of-the-art facility where students can take safety classes before enjoying the pistol, rifle, and shotgun ranges.

The Liberty Equestrian Center expands over a 380-acre property on Liberty Mountain.  The center features both indoor and outdoor racing arenas, as well as three barns that house 78 horse stalls.  Students have the opportunities to take a free trail ride or take additional lessons at a low cost.
And on the same property, Liberty has an observatory where students can enjoy a beautiful night under the stars using a 24-inch telescope.
